text:
He thought that if he could hide everything in the water, it would all be over. He had decided this during a restless night when he felt like getting up and leaving quickly to get rid of everything. But getting rid of it turned out to be very hard. He walked along the Ekaterininsky Canal for over half an hour and looked at the steps leading down to the water several times, but he couldn't go through with his plan. There were rafts at the steps, and women were washing clothes on them, plus boats were tied up nearby, and there were people everywhere. He could be seen from all around, and it would look suspicious for a man to go down, stop, and throw something into the water. What if the boxes floated instead of sinking? Of course, they would. It felt like everyone he met was watching him. “Is it just my imagination?” he wondered.

Finally, he thought it might be better to go to the Neva. There weren't as many people there, so he would be less noticed, and it would be easier in every way, especially since it was further away. He couldn't believe he had spent half an hour worrying and being anxious about a silly plan, just because he thought of it when he was in a daze! He realized he had become very forgetful and knew he needed to hurry.

He walked towards the Neva along V—— Prospect.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The protagonist struggles with the difficulty of disposing of incriminating items while feeling increasingly paranoid and observed.
